title: Southern/Country typefaces
content:
I’m doing a school project where we are to create a menu for a Cracker Barrel style restuarant and store. Could you please suggest some typefaces for me to use. The whole project will have an old west, southern, and down home coutry feel.

Thanks,

Chris

 [‹ Galahad as Logotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709012447/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32252 "Go to previous forum topic") [Grouping of character widths ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709012447/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31468 "Go to next forum topic")
author: chrisbutts

comments.content:
The Font Diner “Country Picnic” menu might work and it’s cheap.

[http://www.fontdiner.com/main.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709012447/http:/www.fontdiner.com/main.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/main.html")

Another good option is Sudtipos.

[http://www.sudtipos.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709012447/http:/www.sudtipos.com/ "http://www.sudtipos.com")

Eduardo Tunni

For a country western flavour, do a MyFonts search for [Tuscan](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709012447/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tuscan&itemsperpage=50&sourceid=Mozilla-search) or [Woodtype](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709012447/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=woodtype&itemsperpage=50&sourceid=Mozilla-search).

- Lex

I’ve used Clarendon with great success in several BBQ cookbooks.

Luke.
Thank you all for the help so far. I’ll check into all of these!
